articles.title: ‘Strangles’: Highly contagious bacterial disease threatens Okanagan horses
articles.description: 'It’s a huge economic impact on everybody,' equine veterinarian Janice Posnikoff said. 'And more than that, the horses get really sick.'

articles.title: Business owner in Kelowna’s Rutland area pleads for more attention to crime, social issues
articles.description: At a news conference on Tuesday, RCMP said with Kelowna being a growing city with growing challenges, priorities have to be triaged.

articles.title: JPMorgan, Brookfield See Deals Revival for Clean Energy Assets
articles.description: Clean energy projects are poised for a revival in mergers and acquisitions activity on the strengthening outlook for electricity demand and as expectations on asset valuations converge, according to some of the sector’s top dealmakers.

articles.title: Canadian visas for 2.9 million temporary residents expire in 2025 and 2026
articles.description: Nearly three million people living in Canada on temporary resident, worker, or visitor extension permits have visas that expired last year, or will expire this year, not including student visas. articles.title: Edmonton snow-clearing raises mobility concerns as mayor recognizes change is needed
articles.description: Mayor Andrew Knack says this winter's unusually large snowfall has exposed gaps in the city’s removal strategy — and shows funding has not kept pace with Edmonton’s growth.

articles.title: Calgary woman’s act of self-defence prompts another victim to come forward
articles.description: The death of Shahbaz Ahmed, which Calgary police said was a case of self-defence, has prompted another person who had a similar encounter with the man to come forward.

articles.description: Winnipeg Jets defencemen Neal Pionk, Colin Miller, and Haydn Fleury are all out week-to-week with injuries.

articles.title: IIO investigating Surrey Police arrest of woman in November
articles.description: The Independent Investigations Office of B.C. (IIO) announced Wednesday that it's investigating an incident from November in which a woman was first arrested and later released by the Surrey Police Service (SPS).

articles.title: BHP, Rio Tinto Are Joining Forces to Boost Iron Ore Pipeline
articles.description: BHP Group and Rio Tinto Group, the world’s two biggest mining companies, are poised to join forces in Australia’s Pilbara iron ore hub to add 200 million tons in annual output of the steelmaking material.
